snippet: The increase of 100,000 barrels a day, to 1.32 million, appeared to reflect the impact of an easing of sanctions under a temporary nuclear accord.
abstract: Sales of Iranian crude oil rise by 100,000 barrels a day in January, to 1.32 million, offering glimpse at initial impact of temporary nuclear agreement that eased some Western sanctions against Iran.
lead_paragraph: The increase of 100,000 barrels a day, to 1.32 million, appeared to reflect the impact of an easing of sanctions under a temporary nuclear accord.

headline.main: Sales of Iranian Crude Oil Rose in January
headline.print_headline: Iran: Overseas Sales of Crude Oil Rise as Nuclear Deal Eases Some Sanctions
